column4: with the Gnome GLSlideshow screensaver, where do I place pictures for it to cycle?
install xscreensaver again - gnome-screensaver has decided not to actually support existing screensaver features :|
it's in repos - Universe, I think - pretty sure the package is planetpenguin-racer
there are some commercial games w/ Linux versions - all the iD stuff, for example
I'm not sure, and I'm not on my home machine so I can't check easily. Search Synaptic for 'splashscreen'
you know helix player is in the Ubuntu repos? Shouldn't need any command line fiddling to make it work
go Applications->Add/Remove, search for 'helix' then click once. Done.
you'll need to move the dropdown to "All Available Applications" in Add/Remove
probably because you hadn't created it? I've no idea, though - why not just install helix thru add/remove or synaptic?
when you were using the command line, had you changed directories to the Desktop?
do you have a gutsy alternate CD in the drive?
you can't upgrade from feisty to gutsy with a feisty CD
yes. Go System->Admin->Update Manager, it should have a button for "Upgrade To New Version" or similar.
take the feisty CD out, it's just confusing things.
OK, and what does Update Manager say?
didn't work is a bit vague... what exactly didn't work, and how did it break?
what downloads what upgrade thing? awfully hard to help you unless you're more specific, mate...
close Update Manager, go System->Admin->Software Sources. Make sure the entries there for the CD are NOT ticked. Then try Update Manager again.
